ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed my skills immensely in this course. I learned how to read and write the Korean alphabet in addition to basic vocabulary for speaking. Additionally, I learned more about Korean culture.

This course was a great introduction to Korean! By the end of the semester, I was able to read, write, speak, and understand a significant amount of Korean. It was a very fun and well-structured language course and I look forward to taking Korean L2 next semester.
Basic Korean grammar, vocabulary, and dialogue
Basic Korean grammar, speaking, writing. Started with the alphabet and then went into simple phrases.
Reading and comprehending Hangul, speaking practice, and writing practice.
Reading, writing, speaking and pronounciation, listening, cultural information
Aside from learning the basics to speaking, writing, and understanding the Korean, we also got a better understanding of the roots, creation, and structure of the language and culture.

I learned a basic knowledge of Korean sentences and grammar. We learned the alphabet, in additional to some formal tenses and a lot of vocabulary. I have developed some ability to speak Korean though of course my abilities are extremely limited.
I learned the basics of speaking, reading, and writing Korean. I also absorbed a bit about general Korean culture through peer cultural presentations.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths of this course was the pace and expectation. I never felt overwhelmed or stressed by the amount of material.
Strengths: The professor was amazing! Very enthusiastic, knowledgable, approachable, and willing to help. The course was structured very well and moved at a good pace. Weaknesses: None!

Professor Lim is very kind and encouraging! The strength of this course was that most assignments are graded as complete/incomplete which takes the pressure off of being 'perfect' as you're learning a new language. A weakness was that the assigned TA for my section was not great.

Strengths: Professor Lim is amazinggg. The class is really fun and he really cares about his students. 
Weaknesses: Sometimes the homework (especially the open your ears wide listening) didn't quite correspond to what we were learning in class.

Strengths - each class was very interactive and relied on participation, which made it easier to grasp Korean. Weaknesses - very few weaknesses other than homework not doing much to assist my learning as I felt the exercises were either too easy or too difficult.

The amount of interraction with classmates was really goodspeaking practice and made it fun to go to class every day. I also think the homework system of grading on completion was really helpful as well for an L1 level. You are free to try your best and be rewarded for that.

It provided a good basis on which to learn Korean without too much pressure on grades while doing so. It is test intensive which does take up studying time, however the overall structure and pace of the class felt good. The main weakness of the class is the disparity between students' levels in Korean. Some had a much larger basis of knowledge for Korean or other similar languages, and therefore the class sometimes felt catered towards them rather than complete beginners.

The course has strengths in that meeting every day helps reinforce member of vocabulary and grammar patterns. Another strength was that our instructor had us frequently practicing speaking with partners and, on occasion, mingle with the whole classroom practicing speaking. I would have liked to have even more of these classroom-wide mingling activities.
Korean 110 is a great introductory language course! Not a lot of work compared to the other east Asian languages, and the instructor really care for you!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, and specifically for the professor. My professor made the class super engaging.
I would recommend this class. I learned a lot and genuinely enjoyed the class time we had. The workload is very reasonable as well.
Yes! I was amazed by how much Korean I learned in a single semester. It was also a very fun class; I looked forward to going to class everyday!

Yes! Professor Lim truly fosters a safe space for anyone to learn Korean! I never felt overwhelmed by everything that we were learning at any point. I think everything was spaced out with a lot of thought.

Yes!! I took this class for fun as a senior, and I'm so glad I did! Just make sure you're up for meeting every single day, because that can get tiring. But overall, Korean seems much easier than many of the other languages, but you still learn a lot and it's fun.

I would recommend this course to anyone interested in learning Korean. It was well-structured and allowed for an easy transition into the class. If you struggle with learning alphabets, I would try to review beforehand as we only spent a week or two on learning how to read.
Yes! It's a great language and L1 was a very approachable introduction.
I would recommend this course to another student. The professor was incredible, I was constantly engaged in the class, and the material is very useful.

Absolutely. Korean is a very interesting language by itself but the main thing is Hyunsung Lim. If he continues to teach the course, than I would recommend it wholeheartedly given its relative ease and the overall enjoyable experience.
Absolutely! It was a fun and approachable learning environment.

Yes! Korean offers a surprisingly laid back atmosphere. Despite that, I learned a lot in the language, and none of the work really felt like busy work. The instructors are also really amazing! They really care about you!
